body.name: Universal Speaker Wall Mount for JBL, Bose, Sony, Sonos, Logitech, Roku Speaker Mount, Adjustable Wall Shelf for Most of Speaker Shelf, Wooden Floating Wall Shelves with Hardware Kit, Set of 2
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 23 hrs 55 mins
features: Universal Wall Shelves: Universal speakers mounting bracket fits most of small speakers with width within 5.5", such as: for JBL Go 3, Flip 4/5/6, Charge 3/4/5; for Bose Home Speaker 500, SoundLink Revolve/Revolve+/Micro/Flex; for Sony SRS-XB13/XB23/XB33; for Sonos ONE, ONE SL, Play 1, Play:3, Move, Roam; for Logitech Z207/Z313/Z333/Z407/Z533/Z606/Z623/Z625/Z906; for Roku wireless speakers and more.

Save Space: The small wooden boards are design to save your tabletop space, making full use of the empty wall space to mount your speaker on the wall, which can bring you a more immersive music effects, also can be used as a home decoration to make your home more attractive.

Curved Edge Designed: Different from other floating shelves, our wooden shelves have a special design at the four corners, which can protect you from injury while using, and are very friendly for both adults and children, not easy to hurt.

Stable and Durable: This speaker mount is made of thick wooden boards and high quality metal material, the max weight capacity of this speaker shelf is 22 lbs, which is safe for placing your speaker. The depth of the floating wall shelf is adjustable and extendable, you can adjust it between 5.3"-6.6", which allows you to place your speaker on it without any worries.

Easy to Install: Come with all hardware kits and a user manual, you can install it within 5 minutes. And you can install it everywhere you want, such as the living room, bedroom, kitchen or office, etc.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful and good quality
reviews.reviewText: Mount to studs! Others complain because they expect drywall to support a pound or MORE, 10 inches away from the wall. If your only choice is drywall then use butterfly anchors and you'll be fine. They are real wood andhave great metal plates. I replaced the plastic washers with metal ones that mount the shelf to the angled plate just for assurance. If your looking for surround mounts, these are the ones to get (if the wood color matches your environment. 5 stars for the price!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Item was exactly as it was described, fast shipping and good communicator. Would buy from again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Mounting Wall Anchors not Effective
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Perfect for these smaller speakers. Easy to mount... The packaged wall anchors were useless. They didn't grip the wall properly. Used a different anchor. I didn't bother to call the supplier. They had a red "warning" concerning the wall anchors. Makes you wonder a bit.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2023
reviews.reviewText: These shelves are not sturdy. With the smallest speakers the shelves bend and lean.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Can’t support a speaker over 3 lbs
reviews.reviewText: I have two major gripes with this product.First off, the photoshoped product photography’s scaling is off. This product is way smaller then the photography implies. This is only a viable option for standard alexa speakers or small portable speakers like the jbl pulse (which doesn't even need a shelf to begin with).For reference, I included an image with the shelf (with the bracket extended to its max) next to the JBL Extremes, JBL Pulse 2, a Sonos, a half height Alexa, and both a small and full sized Alexa Show.Anything more meaningful in size and the shelf just can’t support it. My 3.14lb Sonos speakers were too heavy for the included anchors which causes the shelf to sag. My slightly larger (yet still small) OS-10 Swan speakers at 4.5lbs don’t fit on the shelves properly and sag under the weight unless they are screwed directly into studs. As a result I am temporarily forced to use just one of these shelves since the studs in my wall are not symmetrical with my TV. Let me remind you this is supposed to be rated for 22lbs and can’t even handle 3 properly thanks to the provided anchors being so bad.This was also not fun to install. Its hard to align a drill due to how the bracket sticks out. Had to remove it once from my original mounting points due to the sag and I stripped the head of the screw when trying to utilize the stud in my wall on my reinstall.Overall, I don't understand this product. All the speakers you would want to hang with dual channels are simply too big or too heavy for this to be useful. The only usecase I can see this maybe being used for is a small smart-home device (like an Alexa with a small footprint) which only requires a single shelf. Even then, an Alexa tends to look just fine on a counter top or side table.This product simply does not work for what it is advertised for. This would be better suited as a small nic nac shelf then a speaker shelf.Needless to say I don’t plan on using these long term for anything more than a possible nic nac shelf for displaying lenses or something.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Love these compact and easy to hang

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Anchors are cheap
reviews.reviewText: This little shelf is nice. Only issue I had is the anchors are tiny. Had to drill out the bracket so I could use heavy duty wall anchors to put my Sonos speaker on it. The anchors provided will not hold otherwise.
